comments.creator: akos.brain@gmail.com
comments.text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:7.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/7.0.1
Build ID: 20110928134238

Steps to reproduce:

I've created a filter, that checks the x-message-flag field on the message and tags it as task automatically if it's a FollowUp. It only does it this way, I don't have a filter for the other way around. 
I did this for better exchange integration.
From another machine I removed the FollowUp flag from the message knowing that it's already tagged as Task


Actual results:

To my supprise at the next update the Task tag was removed.


Expected results:

Tags and FollowUp are two separate things. The Task tag should remain.
comments.author: akos.brain@gmail.com

comments.author: acelists@atlas.sk
comments.text: Can you post the headers of the message (mainly the X-Mozilla-* ones) after you apply the filter. How do you then remove the followup flag from another machine? Is the message on an IMAP server? Post the headers after that operation and also after the update where the tags are removed. So we need to see 3 sets of headers.
comments.creator: acelists@atlas.sk

comments.creator: acelists@atlas.sk
comments.raw_text:
But there are no X-Mozilla-* headers there... Have you taken everything starting at the "From - <date>" line? At least that is how messages are stored in local mbox file (when using pop3 and maybe caching imap messages).
Does your server support storing user defined headers?

comments.text:
I confirm this issue. I am using Daily Thunderbird (13.0a1, 2012-03-13) on Mac OSX 10.7 Lion. I am accessing my Exchange Email account both from Outlook:Mac (native connector) and Thunderbird (IMAP).

1/ Tag a mail as "Work" in TB
1.1/ message appears as Orange (default colors)
1.2/ [Get Mail] to sync with the server
2/ In Outlook "Follow-up" the message
2.1/ [Send-Receive] to sync with the server
3/ TB: [Get Mail]
3.1/ Label "Work" is removed from the message...
comments.author: fix.kowalski@gmail.com
comments.creator: fix.kowalski@gmail.com

comments.creator: thee.chicago.wolf@gmail.com
comments.raw_text:
(In reply to Wayne Mery (:wsmwk) from comment #11)
> TCW, Can you reproduce with comment 8?

I can't. I can get as far as step 1.2 but since I don't have Outlook I can't go further or use its Follow Up feature to find out if it removes the orange tag. In 9 years, I'd think this is probably a dead end by now.

I tried what's in https://www.bettertechtips.com/office/set-a-follow-up-reminder-in-thunderbird/ to set it to do a Follow-Up butt it didn't work either. Apparently there are Add-Ons that do this Follow-Up task too but without Outlook's propriety, seems moot for me. Sorry.
